channel.title: About Me on Code by Ember Zhang
channel.description: Recent content in About Me on Code by Ember Zhang

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hello there, I’m Ember Zhang, a software developer based in New York City. I work across the full-stack and specialize in Python, Ruby on Rails, and JavaScript / React.JS. I enjoy learning & personal development, delving deep into science and history books, powerlifting, short-track speedskating, travel, playing the Chinese guqin, and spending time with my partner in the city.

item.title: Rose Garden
item.description: Description The Rose Garden Game is a game developed in React.JS andJavaScript. Purpose The Rose Garden game was designed for the Center for Computational Psychiatry at Mount Sinai Hospital to differentiate between clinical populations with obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) and healthy control (HC) populations. The task is inspired by the classic “two-stage” task paradigm in cognitive behavioral research. Gameplay Overview The player plays rounds of two repeating choices followed in succession:

item.title: Dungeons and Portals
item.description: Description The Dungeons & Portals Game is a platformer game developed in vanilla JavaScript within a Flask application. Link: https://dungeons-and-portals.onrender.com/ Purpose The Dungeons & Portals Game was designed for the Center for Computational Psychiatry at Mount Sinai Hospital to differentiate between clinical populations with behavioral compulsions and healthy control (HC) populations. Dungeons and Portals Screenshot 1 Dungeons and Portals Screenshot 2 Overview Objective: Throughout the game, the player to determine the best dungeon to enter, then tries to exit using the fewest number of teleportations through portals as possible.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
